docs.title: Google Developer Groups (GDG) — IAU — Game Development Bootcamp
Welcome to the GDG Game Development Bootcamp!
docs.text: Welcome to the Game Development Bootcamp of the Google Developer Groups (GDG) club at the Imam Abdulrahman Bin Faisal University (IAU). Our main focus here is to train and prepare students to develop their own games, and help kick-off their career in game development.

docs.title: About Us
docs.text: We're a group of passionate game developers eager to help others learn more about the wonders of game development and help develop their knowledge and skills. We try to create educational content that's fitting for both experienced developers and novices. Whether you're a seasoned expert of game development, or just starting your journey, there's a place for you here.

docs.title: What To Expect
docs.text: We have created a 4 week course for aspiring game developers of the club to participate in. Each week will focus on a set of game development concepts and will have tutorials and live sessions to help develop the students skills. In addition to the general course, a group of students within the club will be specially selected to partake in "focus group" teams that will receive direct mentorship from the track's leaders and assistance in creating a demo for their own, unique game.

docs.title: The Plan
docs.text: The course will last for 4 weeks. Each week will cover certain concepts, have live-coding sessions, and tasks for students to complete.

docs.title: Week 1 - Introduction to Game Programming
docs.text:
Key Concepts

  • What is a game?

  • What is a video game?

  • How do video games really work?

  • Understand the game loop.

  • Understanding coordinate systems and other basic game math concepts.

  • How to use delta time to ensure consistent physics.

  • Make Pong using Raylib and C++ as an introduction to game programming.

Tasks

  • Recreate Pong following the tutorial, and add certain basic functions to it.

docs.title: Week 2 - Introduction to Game Engines and Godot
docs.text:
Key Concepts

  • What is a game engine?

  • Basic game engine concepts.

  • What is Godot?

  • Understanding nodes, scenes, and scripts.

  • Using nodes and scripts to make a moving square.

  • Understanding input maps.

  • Understanding collision layers/masks, and movement functions.

  • Using autoloads and signals.

  • Making Pong again in Godot.

Tasks

  • Make Pong following the tutorial again and make certain adjustments to it.

docs.title: Week 3 - Making a 2D Platformer in Godot
docs.text:
Key Concepts:

  • How to import assets to your Godot project.

  • Understanding tilemaps.

  • Understanding 2D animations and spritesheets.

  • How to write scripts for 2D Platformers.

  • Making a camera that follows the player.

  • Making a simple 2D platformer with levels and progression.

  • How to export a game in Godot.

Tasks

  • Make a 2D platformer following the tutorial and add certain features and mechanics.

docs.title: Week 4 - Making a Top-Down Survival Game in Godot
docs.text:
Key Concepts

  • How to make a game in the top-down plane.

  • Making simple AI for enemies.

  • Making a wave-based enemy system.

  • Creating an item-generation system.

  • Making a menu and UI for the game.

Tasks

  • Follow the tutorial and add certain mechanics.
